loans.name: Isaias

texts.en:
Isaias is 25 years old and works as a driver for a company that provides transportation services in a gold mining zone. He lives with his partner and is raising a 9-month-old son. He works about 10 hours a day between midnight and mid-day. Isaias is requesting a loan in order to obtain a commercial driver’s license. His dream is to work for a large company, and to one day purchase his own vehicle.

Isaias is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to obtain a commercial driver's license.

loans.name: Myskal

texts.ru: Мыскал 64 года, замужем. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Мыскал занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2007 году с 50,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Мыскал, ее поголовье насчитывает 1 корову, 1 лошадь и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мыскал обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Мыскал планирует вложить в расширение бизнес – деятельности посредством посадки картофеля.
texts.en: Myskal is 64 years old and married.  She is involved in animal husbandry to provide a source of income for her family.  The business, started in 2007 with 50,000 som (KGS), today yields about 3,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  Thanks to Myskal's persistent work, her livestock headcount includes one cow, one horse and ten sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Myskal requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business by planting potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a young client, 28 years old, married and has one child.

Since 2008, Ahmad has been an owner of a shop selling construction materials.   He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and his shop is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $3000 to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family. Because he is under 30, Ahmad qualifies for a "youth loan".

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his construction shop.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada de seguros en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para terminar sus estudios superiores en contabilidad y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su hijo.
Ramiro, es soltero y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una casa alquilada en la zona Villa Fátima de la cuidad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Ramiro works as an employee in a private insurance company in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to finish his higher education courses in Accounting so that he can improve his income to support his son.  Ramiro is single and has a son he lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz's Villa Fátima sector.  This is the first time he's worked with IMPRO and first time with KIVA too.

loans.use: to complete his accounting courses.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene ingresos de la renta que recibe cada mes y también se dedica al comercio junto a su esposa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena y piedra para la construcción de un garaje en su casa para brindar más comodidad a su familia, pues actualmente la movilidad que tiene la parquea en la calle y es muy peligroso.
Pedro, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en casa propia en la zona Las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en: Pedro earns income from rent he receives monthly and also works as a merchant together with his wife.  He needs the loan to build a garage at his house to provide more comfort for his family because he currently parks his car in the street and that's very dangerous.  Pedro is married and has four children he lives with in his own house located in the city of La Paz's Las Lomas zone.  This is the second time he works with IMPRO and the first with KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and rocks to build a garage in his home

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, estudia Veterinaria en la universidad, ella  obtiene ingresos de forma independiente ya que viaja a los pueblos a vacunar a los animales y de esta forma pagar sus estudios.
El crédito lo requiere para tramitar su titulo de bachiller y culminar cursos superiores para obtener mas ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Liliana, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Tembladerani ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Liliana is studying Veterinary Scienceds at the university.  She earns income independently because she travels to towns to vaccinate animals and this is how she pays for her schooling.  She needs the loan to pay fees to register her Bachelor's Degree and to complete higher education courses to obtain more income and help her family.  Liliana is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents' house in the city of La Paz's Tembladerani zone.  It's the first time she's worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay fees to register her diploma at the Ministry of Education.

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante, trabaja como consultor  y supervisor de un restaurante  ya que tiene un contrato en la ciudad de Santa Cruz. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una cocina, un refrigerador y cubrir el costo dela instalación de su propio restaurante para tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Dante, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Dante works as a consultant and restaurant manager since he has a contract with the city of Santa Cruz.  He needs the loan to set up his own restaurant to earn income to help his family.  Dante is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents' house in the city of La Paz's Irpavi zone.  It's the third time he's worked with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase a stove, a refrigerator, and the cost of installation to open his own restaurant

loans.name: Sarah

texts.es:
Sarah, trabaja independientemente ya que es Psicóloga, también recibe ingresos de su ex esposo para mantener a sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para terminar sus estudios superiores y de esta forma obtener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Sarah, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Sarah works independently as a psychologist. She also receives income from her ex-husband in order to support her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to finish her higher education so that she can earn more income for supporting her family. Sarah is divorced and has two children. They live at her parents' house in the District of Obrajes in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of finishing her higher education in psychology.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia  residente en el municipio de Galapa, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 22 años. Ella es una incansable trabajadora que se dedica a una actividad comercial, a través de la cual  ofrece sus productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos; así mismo compra independientemente mercancías que no trae su guía, y como ingreso complementario,  también vende verduras.  Se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 8 años aproximadamente; con esta labor ayuda en gran parte a los gastos del hogar y se siente muy feliz de poder hacerlo. Sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad, lo que le  permite aportar a los egresos de su familia y cubrir sus gastos personales, Su esposo tiene una motocicleta en la que ofrece el servicio de transporte, que también genera ingresos. Patricia maneja un margen de rentabilidad acorde al tipo de negocio que opera, mientras su cartera rota ágilmente. Últimamente su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la creciente demanda que tiene;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  productos por catalogo como colonias, mascarillas, bases faciales, cremas, gel, delineador, desodorantes, productos que tiene encargados, aprovechando las ofertas que vienen en cada campaña de ventas; también invertirá en su negocio de verduras,comprando este producto que le genera buenos ingresos.   Su inversión supone él éxito, porque aplicaría los descuentos a su precio de ventas y con ellos continuaría su proceso de aumentar y fidelizar el número de clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the town of Galapa, 20 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She’s a married woman who has three children whose ages range from 20 to 22 years.  She is a tireless worker engaged in a commercial activity through which she sells products via specialized guidebooks or catalogues.  She also buys items independently that are not included in the catalogues and as an additional source of income also sells vegetables.

She’s been in this commercial activity for about 8 years and through this labor is able to help out with a large part of household expenses and she feels very happy to be able to do so.  Her monthly sales generate a good profit margin which allows her to contribute to family spending and cover her personal expenses.  Her husband has a motorcycle that he provides transportation services with and also generates income.

Patricia’s profit margin is in line with the type of business she operates and her stock rotates quickly.  Lately, her working capital is insufficient to meet growing customer demand and this is why she’s calling upon a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy catalogue items like cologne, face masks, make-up foundation, creams, gels, eyeliner, deodorants and products she has pending orders for taking advantage of sales specials.  She will also invest in her vegetable business buying products that generate good income.  Her investment augurs success because she will apply the discounts to her sales prices thus continuing the process of increasing the number of her regular customers.

loans.use: to buy catalogue cosmetics and vegetables.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 57 years old, divorced and has one child.

Zahra is a tailor since 1998; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally as suits, coats and dresses for women. She has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is being well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for $1800 loan in order to purchase tailoring machine and to add more goods. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and to add more goods.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and 5 dependents. Ekua sells cloth, she has been selling cloth for 2 years now. Ekua uses her income to assist the husband to pay their utility bills.  Ekua will use her loan to purchase more cloth to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sell

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is 45 years old and has been raising cattle and sheep for the past 17 years. He purchases the animals when they are small and skinny and fattens them so he can sell them for a profit. In addition, he sells the milk that his cows produce. Julian is receiving his first loan from Asociación Arariwa and is grateful for the opportunity to improve his business. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase more cows. He is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 25, all of whom are living independently.

Julian recently joined the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is 26 years old and operates a front-end loader at a gold mine. He has held this position for two years. Jose Luis is requesting a loan in order to purchase land so that he can build a house. He hopes to continue working with heavy machinery and to obtain certificates that will allow him to operate other types of equipment at the mines.

Jose Luis is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy land for a house.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin is 25 years old and raising a son of 1 year and 9 months with his partner. He has held a job as a construction worker for the past two years, mostly working as a contractor on housing projects. He is requesting the loan in order to help his nephew buy land so he can build a house. Valentin’s dream for the future is to be able to live independently and adequately support his family.

Valentin is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy land for a house.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo runs a business from his home selling alpaca wool. He purchases wool of all colors and styles from alpaca herders who live in the countryside at higher altitudes. He then sells the wool from a store in his house. Camilo is 32 years old and has been engaged in this business since he was 19 years old. He is married and has a 1.5-year-old son and an 11-year-old daughter. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more alpaca wool. He dreams of obtaining bigger loans in the future so that he can expand his business.

Camilo is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is 39 years old and lives with his partner and two sons, who are 12 and 14 years old. He has been a construction worker for ten years, mostly working as a contractor on all types of structural projects. Depending on his project, he typically works almost every day of the week from 7am to 5-6 pm. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction tools, such as a concrete mixer and a winch, which is a tool used to adjust the tension of a rope or cable. Gerardo dreams of opening a hardware shop one day, as well as owning a car.

Gerardo is a member of the village bank “Sr. de Ccoylloritty de Ocongate,” which is receiving its eighth loan from Asociación Arariwa. The group members live in a fairly remote rural community several hours outside of Cusco city, located at an altitude of 3,800 meters up in the Andean mountains.

loans.use: to buy construction tools such as a concrete mixer and winch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more kale, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 42-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be visionary and creative. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for seven months and employs two staff members. His business is located at an ideal and viable place for the business, and his primary customers are men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat. Peter's dream and business goal is to run another butcher shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more meat for selling

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 50 years old. She has 5 children aged between 1 and 26 years old four of them attend school. She has been selling charcoal for the past 3 years. With the loan she wants to buy more charcoal for sell. With the profits she plans to pay school fees for the children who attend school. The picture was taken at UOB's lending staff office.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fruits, sweets, and biscuits

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a married man. He has 6 children, whose ages range from 2 to 16 years. He describes himself as a determined and visionary man. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a busy and viable market, and his primary customers are students, men, and women. He describes insufficient funds for improving the business as his biggest business challenge. 

Gideon will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more leather for making shoes and to pay his employees. Gideon's business goal is to be a distributor of shoes and to increase his income within five years.

loans.use: to pay employees and buy leather.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman. She has 3 children, whose ages range from 2 to 10 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells kale. She has been involved in this business for six months. Her business is located in an ideal business environment, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes inadequate funds as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more kale. 

Violet's business goal is to run another grocery store. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a lorry to help supply vegetables to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more kale for sale.

loans.name: Calleb

texts.en:
Calleb is a married man. He has 3 children, whose ages range from 3 to 10 years. He describes himself as an aggressive, determined, and visionary man. He operates a barber shop where he provides haircut services. He has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. His business is located in an ideal business environment, and his primary customers are students and men. He describes inadequate funds as his biggest business challenge. 

Calleb will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy another electric shaver. His business goal is to run another barber shop.

loans.use: to buy an electric shaver.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 48-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 26 years old. She describes herself as an honest, aggressive, and intelligent woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She employs three staff members. Her business is located in a competitive, busy market, and her primary customers are women. She describes insufficent funds for improving the business as her biggest business challenge. 

Juliet will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. Juliet's dream and business goal is to expand her business and be a distributor of clothes within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vasilyi

texts.ru:
Василий – фермер-сельскохозяйственник из Водяного. Он вместе с семьей занимается тепличным бизнесом. Он выращивает ранние овощи, а именно помидоры, огурцы и редис. Василий владеет большим участком земли. У него есть 4 большие теплицы размером 10х60 метров, а также две теплица для рассады. Выращиванием овощей занимается уже 6 лет. Ежегодно тратит на семена и полиэтиленовую пленку около 67 000 гривен. 

Недавно Василий сделал отопление на все теплицы, установив два больших котла. Это значительно улучшило качество его продукции. Теперь Василию необходима дополнительная сумма в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести пленку, уголь и семена для своих теплиц на эту весну. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Vasilyi is a farmer-agriculturalist from Vodyanoye.  Together with his family, he is involved in a greenhouse business.  He grows early vegetables, specifically tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  Vasilyi owns a large plot of land.  He has four large, 10x60 meter greenhouses and also two greenhouses for seedlings.  He has been involved in growing vegetables for six years.  Annually, he spends about 67,000 hryvnia on seeds and plastic.  Recently, Vasilyi provisioned heating in all of his greenhouses by installing two large boilers.  This significantly improved the quality of his produce.  Currently, Vasilyi needs an additional amount of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase plastic, coal and seeds for his greenhouses for this spring.

loans.use: to buy plastic, coal and seeds for his greenhouses for the spring

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.ru:
Анатолий с семьей живет в селе Нововодяное. Она выращивает ранние редис, огурцы и помидоры. Анатолий имеет большой участок земли, на котором он поставил 4 теплицы и одну дополнительную под рассаду. В хозяйство он вложил около 90 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют около 27 000 гривен. 

Анатолий планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку семян, пленки и удобрений, чтобы подготовиться к весеннему сезону. Анатолия все знают, как очень трудолюбивого человека и предпринимателя, которому всегда интересно развиваться дальше. Занимаясь фермерством вот уже 17 лет, как научили родители, он хочет двигаться дальше и вкладывать в свое хозяйство. Анатолий надеется закончить ремонт во дворе и продолжать устраивать быт своей семьи. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Anatolyi and his family live in the Novovodyanoye village.  He grows early radishes, cucumbers and tomatoes.  Anatolyi has a large plot of land, where he built four greenhouses and one additional for seedlings.  He invested about 90,000 hryvnia into the business.  His annual expenses for seeds and plastic amount to about 27,000 hryvnia.  Anatolyi plans to invest the Kiva loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia into a purchase of seeds, plastic and fertilizers in order to prepare for the spring season.  Everyone knows Anatolyi as a hardworking person and entrepreneur, who is always interested in developing his business further.  Having been involved in farming for 17 years, as taught by his parents, he wants to continue moving forward and investing in his business.  Anatolyi hopes to complete repairs in a yard and continue to improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plastic and fertilizers in order to prepare for the spring season

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Exitosos Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Los Inversionistas Exitosos” es un banco comunal nuevo que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y está conformado por  6 mujeres y 5 varones. Sus reuniones del banco comunal van a ser cada treinta días y todos los socios tienen que estar presentes en las reuniones programadas sino van a pagar una multa. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
  
(El socio John esta levantando la mano en la fotografia). 

El socio John tiene 30 años edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.). 

El socio John es profesional estudio en una de las escuelas más prestigiosas de la ciudad del Cusco. El trabajó en una entidad pública como restaurador pero tuvo que dejar de trabajar para graduarse como profesional en restauración. Actualmente, John trabaja para el Arzobispo de la ciudad del Cusco como restaurador de obras de artes, él nos cuenta que trabaja en el área de proyección de inversión de los templos de diferentes  pueblos de la región. El proyecto se encarga de restaurar y salvaguardar las iglesias que fueron construidos en los siglos XVI y XVII. El sueño del Socio John es implementar un taller o escuela de restauración en alguna provincia del departamento del Cusco, él quiere enseñar a  tallar, pintar y restaurar a niños y jóvenes de bajos recursos para que puedan valor su patrimonio cultural. 

El socio John en sociedad con su hermano, tienen un bar en la ciudad de Machupicchu. Ya son varios años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien. En esta oportunidad John requiere el préstamo para implementar el bar y desea comprar copas, jarras y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Inversionistas Exitosos” (The Successful Investors) is a new communal bank that belongs to the Asociación Arariwa and is made up of six women and five men. The communal bank’s meeting will be every thirty days and all the members have to be at the scheduled meetings or they will pay a fine. The majority of the members are neighbors and have a good relationship. 

The members are workers and entrepreneurs who look for opportunities all the time in order to get ahead and, with their daily effort, to create a better future for their children.  

(The member John is raising his hand in the picture.)   

The member John is thirty years old and lives in the city of Cusco. Cusco is known for being an area with a lot of tourism, commerce, for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because it has one of the most marvelous sites in the world— “Machupicchu.” 

The member John is a professional. He studies in one of the most prestigious schools in Cusco. He worked in the public sector as a restorer but he had to leave work in order to graduate as a restoration professional. Now Jhon works for the Archbishop in the city of Cusco as an artwork restorer. He tells us that he fundrasing for the temples of the different towns in the region. The project is responsible for restoring and protecting the churches that were built in the 16th and 17th centuries. John’s dream is to open a restoration workshop or school in some province within the department of Cusco. He wants to teach carving, painting, and restoring to children and young people in lower grades so that they can value their cultural heritage. 

John is in business with his brother, and they have a bar in the city of Machupicchu. They’ve been working in this business for a number of years, and it’s going well for them. At this time John needs a loan in order to set up a bar, and he wants to buy cups, jugs and other things.

loans.use: to set up a bar and buy cups, jugs, and other things.

loans.name: Mame Khar

texts.fr: Madame Mame Khar habite dans une des  communautés  villageoises du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants de 4 et 22 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce et gère un magasin  dans la localité ou elle habite. Elle  vend des habits et des tissus plus particulièrement, mais parallèlement  elle détient une boutique d’alimentation générale dans la meme rue  ou est localisée son magasin. Elle a choisi son activité par passion et s’intéresse  beaucoup aux bénéfices qu’elle lui procure. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une balle d’habits de friperie  pour les besoins de son commerce. Avec  ce financement elle souhaite renforcer son fond  de roulement.  Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et contribuer a l’amélioration de la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mame Khar lives in a village community in Senegal.  She is married and the mother of two children, age 4 and 22.  She has been working in retail business for over 10 years and she manages a shop in the locality where she lives.  She sells clothes, specifically fabrics, but she also owns a general grocery store in the same street where her other store is located.  She chose this activity out of passion and is very interested in the profits generated through this business.  She has been a member of one of the UIMCEC branches since November 2005.  She has already repaid a previous loan.  She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs which will be used to buy used clothes in bulk, for resale in her store.  With this loan, she would like to strengthen her working capital.  Her goal is to increase her profits and help improve her family's social condition.

loans.use: to buy used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Thianar

texts.fr: Monsieur Thianar  est un jeune tailleur de 40 ans qui s’active en meme temps dans deux domaines d'activités différents.Il gère une activité de transport de moto taxi qu'il confie a un jeune de son quartier et encaisse les revenus qui lui sont procurés journalière ment. C'est une occupation qui est très répandue dans la région ou il vit actuellement.Le moto taxi qu'il détient actuellement lui procure pas mal de revenus et c'est  la raison pour laquelle il a l'intention d'acquérir un deuxième. Thianar est  un habitué du guichet de l'UIMCEC de sa zone d'habitation, il a déjà remboursé 4 prêts antérieurs.Le moto taxi qu'il projette d'acheter  coute 400 000frs.Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs en vue de  compléter son épargne et réaliser son achat. Marié, et père de 2 enfants ses  activités  lui permettent   de se procurer des revenus et de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.  Dans l’avenir, il souhaite démarrer une activité de vente  de tissus,; il a aussi l'intention d'acquérir une machine a coudre plus performante dans l'objectif d'améliorer les services qu'il offre a sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mister Thianar is a young 40 year old tailor who is busy doing a little of everything as he also provides transportation by motorcycle taxi which is fashionable in the region. It's moreover the object of the loan that he is requesting. He owns one, and seeing that it generates fairly good profits, he reinvested in this same business. Thianar is also a regular of the branch; he is on his fifth loan. He is going to buy a Djakarta motorcycle that costs 400,000 FCFA. Married and father to two children he takes care of daily expenses. In the future, he is going to diversify his products and services by buying fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: compléter son capital pour l'achat d'un moto taxi destiné a son activité de transport de moto

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Amy .Elle est né en 1954 et s’active dans la vente de fruits et de beignets à la gare routière et cela depuis longtemps.
Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite un montant de 100000F CFA .Elle va mettre une valeur de 75000F CFA pour l’achat de fruits et 25000F CFA pour les beignets. 
Madame  Amy n’a pas de charges, mais avec les bénéfices acquis, elle met un peu d’argent de coté pour qu’un jour, elle puisse ouvrir sa propre boutique qui est son plus grand souhait. Pour cela, elle a besoin de l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Our entrepreneur is named Amy. She was born in 1954 and sells fruit and donuts at the train station; something she has done for a long time. She’s requesting her very 1st loan of 100000F CFA. She says the value of the fruit is 75000F CFA and the donuts, 25000F CFA. 

Amy has no dependents, so of the income she generates, a small amount is put away for the day when she can open her own boutique, which is her biggest dream. To make this come true, she needs the support of the lenders.

loans.use: buy fruit and donuts to resell.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla, who lives with her husband and two children in a small two-bedroom apartment, has owned and operated a small business selling women’s shoes for sevn years. After graduating from a local trade school (having obtained a sewing specialty), Alla could not find a job and so first worked as a salesperson in her mother’s business. After a while she started her own enterprise, and today has three retail outlets. Extensive experience and wise pricing policies help Alla to succeed.

Now requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase a new spring collection of shoes, Alla hopes to earn additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of shoes for retail sale.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei owns a farming business. He grows cucumbers and tomatoes in green houses. This is a seasonal business, and most of the crops are sold in May and June. The earlier one can sell the produce, the better prices are. 

Sergei has been in this business for six years. He enjoys it very much and wants to develop it further.

Sergei is asking for a loan to purchase film for his greenhouses, as well as some seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to raise good crops and have a successful sales season. Sergei is divorced and has one daughter that lives with her mother. Sergei lives with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase greenhouse film, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is married with two adult children. He has a retail business selling vegetables and animal food. He has a large storage place next to his home and sells his products right outside his gates. Vitaliy has been in this business for ten years. He has a very good business location—by a busy road—and many repeat clients. Vitaliy uses his truck to buy and transport the produce. 

Vitaliy is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to buy more produce for sale. Vitaliy wants to take advantage of the busy Spring sales season to increase his profits. His ultimate goal is to purchase a newer and bigger truck to help him further develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase more produce for sale.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka, where she sells children’s clothing in one of the local malls, called “Tsentralnyi.” Lubov was forced to launch her own enterprise 15 years ago when the whole country of Ukraine was struck by economic collapse. She managed to consistently grow and develop her startup and achieve its consistent expansion. 

Currently, Lubov has about 25,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 6,500 Grivnyas a month. Lubov is requesting a 15,000-Grivnya loan to purchase seasonal merchandise. She says she is always ready to excel to please her customers. The way Lubov makes her clients feel will determine her further success, encouraging new customers to buy from her.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is one of 21 members of the village bank “Sumac Ayllu,” located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Juana is 66 years old and widowed. In order to support herself, Juana works as a street vendor, selling homemade food including hot soups and main courses for lunch. She has been engaged in this business all of her life.

Juana is requesting a loan in order to purchase ingredients for her business including rice, sugar, chicken and vegetables. She hopes to continue to prosper and live self-sufficiently.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meal preparation business including rice, sugar, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.en:
Eudocia is one of 14 members of the village bank “Los Alamos de la Estacion” located in the Andean highlands of Urcos, Cusco. Eudocia is 49 years old and married with six children. Her youngest child is 12 years old and the rest are now living independently. Eudocia has run a food and beverage stand at a school for about 30 years. She sells meals such as stir fry, revuelto de panza (cow intestines with vegetables), or a fish platter. In addition, she offers sweets, soft drinks, and other types of beverages to hungry students.

Eudocia estimates that she makes about 20 soles per day in profits (about $7.50), which she uses to purchase ingredients for the next day’s business. Each month, she earns about 350 soles (about $130). 

Eudocia is requesting a loan in order to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, oil, and eggs. She is grateful to receive the loan because she no longer has to depend on loans from the shop owners from whom she purchases supplies. Eudocia wants to be able to continue working as long as she is able to, and loans such as this one helps her keep her business running.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier trabaja independientemente con el negocio de bolsas de plástico, las compra de hospitales y mercados, las procesa y luego las vende a las fábricas.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más bolsas para procesarlas y de esta forma mantener su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Javier, es casado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier works independently at his plastic bag business. He buys the bags from hospitals and markets, processes them, and then eventually sells them to factories. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more bags for processing so that he can maintain his business and increase his income to support his family. Javier is married and has three children. They live at his parents' house in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

This is the third time he has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plastic bags for processing and resale.

loans.name: Maria Diodora

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar más producto para la elaboracion de hamacas y bolsos, ya que tiene encargo de trabajo, para lo que necesitara tener materiales suficientes y poder realizar los pedidos, su compra será en hilo y pita de varios colores.
Ella considera que el negocio está mejorando, debido a la inversión anterior con el préstamo, tambien los ingresos familiares han sido mejor.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan so that she can buy more supplies for making hammocks and bags since she already has orders for her work. Therefore, she needs enough materials to complete these requests. Her purchase will consists of thread and twine of various colors.

María says her business has improved with the investment of her previous loan. In addition, her family income has improved.

loans.use: to buy silk thread and twine of various colors.

loans.name: Samuka

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Samuka.  He is single and has no children. In 2004, Samuka established his radio and perfume business. He began his business, which is his only source of income, because he wanted to enhance his self-reliance. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 720,000 Le every month. 

Samuka would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 Le. Samuka requires a loan in order to buy more perfume and radios for sale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 520,000 Le. In the future, Samuka plans to finish the construction of his home, get married, and acquire a larger shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rerfume and radios for sale.

loans.name: Mohamed M.

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has three children, aged 21, 18, and 14. In 1998, Mohamed established his pharmacy business. He began his business, which is his only source of income, in order to be self-empowered. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about 1,700,000 Le every month. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 Le. He has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy medicines. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 850,000 Le. In the future, Mohamed plans to erect a house at the back of his property, to do international business, and to educate his children and send them abroad. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for sale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La socia  continua con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa ella trae ropa al por mayor y  continua vendiendo en forma independiente al por maenor o de una sola prenda, ella tambien vende en grupo de tres si son tres prendas iguales tiene una rebaja. La socia viajara  a traer nueva mercaderia ahora que inicia una nueva temporada.
texts.en: The member, Delia, continues with her business buying and selling clothing.  She buys clothing wholesale and continues independently selling retail or by article.  She also sells in groups of three and gives a discount if the items are identical.  She will travel to get new merchandise now that a new season is beginning.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 39-year-old married man from Al Russeifeh, Amman, Jordan and a father of three chidren.

Mahmoud has a shop for repairing shoes. He started his business with only one machine for repairing shoes then he purchased an additional machine to meet the needs of the market.

Now, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase a new machine for repairing shoes and he is looking to purchase more new equipment to enlarge his business so as to increase his family income.

loans.use: to purchase a shoe repair machine

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 23-year-old single man from Madaba, Jordan.

Mustafa has a mobile phone accessories shop and he is requesting a youth loan of 600 JD to purchase goods for the shop and make new decorations.

Mustafa is looking to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the shop and make new decorations

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, ya que está iniciando los cultivos de pipián, para ello deberá comprarse abono y herbicidas, con los cuales estará ayudando para que la siembra tenga los cuidados necesarios para que crezca.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a realizar la siembra, la cual le dio la cosecha deseada, siendo abundante y muy provechosa, tambien manifiesta que su familia se vio beneficiada con la producción.
texts.en: Roberto is requesting another loan since he has already started his crop of squash.  For this reason, he needs to buy compost and herbicides to help provide what his crops need to grow.  Roberto says that his previous loan helped him complete his last planting and it resulted in an abundant and fruitful harvest.  He also says that his family has reaped benefits from the production.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.en: Maria Elsa, a 55-year old married lady who describes herself as hard worker with very high values.  She learned the farming trade when she was ten-years old and worked alongside her parents, who taught her everything she knows.  She now works with her husband and, although they've been doing ok so far, she needs a loan in order to purchase a new cow.  She expects that this will raise milk production in the farm, which would hopefully lead to an increase in her family's income. In five years she would like to expand her business and to also begin raising chickens.

loans.use: To buy a cow and to better the quality of her cattle

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Ángel es soltero, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Es mecánico profesional, se dedica en la reparación de motos en general. Tiene su taller propio que está ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad.
Se dedica a esta profesión hace más de 10 años, desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios. Aprendió el oficio de un primo suyo que también es mecánico profesional de motos y fue el que le enseñó todo lo que sabe además de inculcarle para especializarse y trabajar con él en su taller.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas las cuales quiere usar en su taller. Debido a que su negocio está creciendo de a poco y es imprescindible que vaya equipándolo cada vez más.
texts.en:
Ángel, 29, is single and lives with his parents in the city of Carapeguá.  He is a professional mechanic.  He works repairing motorcycles in general, in his own workshop located in a strategic place in the city.

He has worked in this profession for more than ten years, since he finished high school.  He learned the job from one of his cousins who also is a professional motorcycle mechanic and who taught him everything he knows as well as to specialize and work with him in his garage.

He is requesting the loan to buy tools in general because his business is growing gradually and it is essential that he equip it more and more.

loans.use: to buy tools for his garage.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee de 30 años de edad, convive con Reynaldo de 34 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En su querido pueblo, Aydee ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por ello que ahora es toda una conocedora de la actividad agrícola, ante la perdida de su amado esposo le fue muy difícil sobrellevar el asunto y solo tuvo que mirar hacia delante y trabajar por sus hijos. En su parcela cultiva plantas de cacao y café, plantas que le viene brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP; y se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo mas por parte de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Aydee, de 30 años de edad, convive con Reynaldo de 34 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En su querido pueblo, Aydee ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por ello que ahora es toda una conocedora de la actividad agrícola, ante la perdida de su amado esposo le fue muy difícil sobrellevar el asunto y solo tuvo que mirar hacia delante y trabajar por sus hijos. En su parcela cultiva plantas de cacao y café, plantas que le viene brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP; y se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo mas por parte de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos.

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sacrée Plus Group

texts.en:
Toussaint is the leader of the Community Bank “Sacrée Plus,”which is composed of 25 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Toussaint sells soft drinks. He started his business in 2007. With his accumulated profits and good management, the business has prospered. Toussaint decided to join one of MFI Hope’s groups in order to achieve his dream of building a facility for storing soft drinks. Currently, his business generates profits of US$129 per month. Toussaint intends to use the next loan to reinforce his working capital by buying fourteen crates of drinks to resell at profit. He is 56 years old, married, and the father of five children whose ages range from 12 to 33 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to reinforce his working capital by buying fourteen crates of drinks to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has 4 children ages 16, 13, 10, and 7 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is the nephew of his wife.

In 2007, Ibrahim established his motorcycle transport business. He began this business to make him self independent and it is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about 1,600,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy a Victor motorcycle. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Ibrahim plans to secure one more motorbike, to develop his land, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Aïssa est une femme mariée sans enfants. Elle vit avec sa mère, son petit frère et son mari. Elle tient une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires devant son domicile.Ce commerce lui permet de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille ainsi que ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter 4 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile, du sucre et du lait. Son ambition est de construire une boutique.
texts.en:
Aïssa is married and has no children. She lives with her mother, her little brother and her husband. She runs a store selling food products in front of her home. Her business enables her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs, as well as her own.

In order to strengthen her business, Aïssa is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs with which to buy 4 sacs of rice, 2 cans of oil, sugar and milk. She aims to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacs of rice, 2 cans of oil, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with two grown daughters.  She graduated from a college of commerce and used to work as a store vendor.  However, economic crisis hit her hard and she was forced to find new ways to provide for her family.  Today she runs a small business selling artificial flowers, dishware and other retail items in the city marketplace.

Lubov’s venture is unique, and she has loyal clientele who help keep her sales high.  Lubov has been in this niche business for nine years. Presently, she has 50,000 Hryvnia in stock, and her average income is about 8,000 Hryvnia a month. 

Lubov is seeking a loan of 20,000 Hryvnia to purchase new merchandise for the spring season.  She believes it will promote the further expansion of her business and ensure a stable source of income for her and her family.  Lubov is very sincere and serves each of her customers with a smile.  Her warm approach to each individual earns her many return customers, which helps her keep a leading position in this business.

loans.use: purchase new merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.ru:
Арамаис  родился в 1953 году в деревне Неркин Анд, Сьюникского региона. Арамаис окончил восемь классов сельской средней школы, а после этого работал механизатором. В данный момент Арамаис работает ночным сторожем в средней школе. 
Арамаис женат и у него четверо детей: три сына и дочь. У всех детей Арамаиса уже есть свои семьи и вместе с Арамаисом живет один из сыновей вместе со своей молодой семьей.  
Уже 30 лет Арамаис занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, кур и пчел, выращивает овощи, бобовые и ячмень. Также у Арамаиса имеется сельскохозяйственная техника: трактор, пресс для сена и грузовой автомобиль. Сельскохозяйственную продукцию Арамаис продает в городе Капане на рынке. Значительную часть прибыли Арамаис получает благодаря выполнения платных работ с помощью своих сельскохозяйственных механизмов. Занятие сельским хозяйством позволяет Арамаису содержать семью. 
Арамаису необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для покупки нескольких поросят, семян для посева, а также для ремонта сельскохозяйственной техники.
texts.en: Aramayis was born 1953 in the Nerkin And village in Syunik region.  He completed eight grades of a secondary school and then worked as a mechanic.  Currently, Aramayis works as a night security guard at a secondary school.  Aramayis is married and has four children - three sons and a daughter.  All of his children already have their own families, and only one of his sons and his young family live together with Aramayis.  Aramayis has been involved in an agricultural business for 30 years.  He breeds cattle and sheep, keeps chickens and bees and grows vegetables, beans and barley.  Aramayis also has agricultural machinery, such as a tractor, press for hay and a truck.  He sells his agricultural produce at a market in the city of Kapan.  He makes the primary share of his profit thanks to doing paid work with his agricultural machinery.  Involvement in the agricultural business allows Aramayis to support his family.  Aramayis needs a loan in the amount of 800,000 dram to buy several piglets, seeds for sowing and also to repair his agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to buy several piglets, seeds for sowing, and to repair agricultural machinery

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Malick est un jeune commerçant de 22 ans qui s’active depuis 4 ans. Il s’est très tôt lancé dans les affaires. Il possède un magasin de pièces détachées à la gare routière. Il faut aussi noter qu’en dehors de ce métier, Malick fait aussi du transport. Il a décidé de faire un crédit pour acheter  une moto Djakarta afin de pouvoir diversifier ses sources de revenus. Il n’a pas de charges car il est célibataire sans enfant ; c’est pourquoi  il réinvesti son bénéfice dans le magasin. Avec l’appui des préteurs, il compte élargir son domaine d’activité à des champs plus variés et susceptibles de générer du profil.
texts.en:
Malick is a young shopkeeper of 22 years of age, who has been working for 4 years. He went into business at a young age and owns a shop selling spare parts at the bus station. As well as running his shop, he also provides transportation services.

Malick has decided to apply for a loan to buy a Jakarta motorcycle so that he can diversify his revenue sources. He has no financial responsibilities as he is single and has no children, which is why he reinvest his profits into his shop. With the support of the lenders, he intends to extend his business activities into more diverse areas likely to generate a profit.

loans.use: to buy a Jakarta motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Alhassan. He is married and has two children ages 3 years and 4 months. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.

In 2006, Alhassan established his building materials and rice business. He began his business just to enable him to adequately cater to his family, and it is his only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Alhassan would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy cement. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Alhassan plans to establish a branch in Bo, to travel to the holy land of Mecca, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of cement for his business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 44 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  His wife is a trader who makes 200,000 SLL in sales per day. In 1990, Mohamed established his used handbags, schoolbags, and purses business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about  6,744,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Mohamed is requesting his second loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which he will use to purchase used handbags, school bags, and traveling bags.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,012,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to engage in the wholesale business. 

Mohammed feels good about the loan because it helps both in his domestic and business affairs.  He wants to educate his children and these loans enable him to generate more income.  The shortage of goods is his major business problem.  His competition is great as several people are in the same business line.  He goes for quality bales to better his competitors.  

Mohammed began doing business when he was a boy.  He was not able to attend school because he was from a poor home.  He serves about 40 people per day mostly peddlers and ladies.  His business is popular because he has customer care strategies.  He has one assistant, a distant cousin, who usually goes to Freetown to buy his goods twice per month.  

Mohamed saved his profits to build a house and he is now looking forward to expanding his business through the help of this credit service.

loans.use: to purchase used handbags, schoolbags, and traveling bags.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 58 year-old Mohamed. He is married to a trader, and has 8 children aged 30, 26, 24, 20, 18, 16, 15 and 14 years. Four of his children are still going to school. 

In 1972, Mohamed established his rubber slippers and sandals business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL7,542,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase plastic sandals (6 cartons @ SLL400,000, women slippers - 20 pkts @ SLL120,000, the balance SLL200,000 is to be used for transportation costs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL1,131,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to see his four school-aged children go through higher educational institutions. His feeling is good as his business has helped him a lot. He is not nervous about it as, when he retires, his children will continue from where he will stop. He wants his children be well educated and to expand his business.  

The loans help Mohamed's business as it is an addition source of income. He serves retailers in town and in neighboring villages. His business is popular because he offers quality products at affordable prices that suit his customers’ earnings. He has no employee; he and his wife are running the business.  His suppliers are located in Guinea (Conakry) where he usually goes three times in the month by public vehicle. He serves about 40 people per day, mostly peddlers and ladies. His business is popular because he has customers' care strategies. He only has one assistant - a distant cousin. He usually goes to Freetown to buy his goods twice per month by public transport.  Mohamed saved his profits to develop his incomplete building. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic sandals - 6 cartons @ SLL400,000, women slippers - 20 pkts @ SLL120,000, the balance SLL200,000 is to be used for transportation.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Daniel.  He is married and his spouse is a business woman. He has 5 children, aged 15, 12, 8, 5 and 3 years. 

In 2005, Daniel established his spare parts business, selling clutches, fan belts, brake oil, engine oil, filters, bearings, brake pads, brake liners, carbon brushes, spokes, etc.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,891,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans. He now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following items: clutches - 30 sets @ SLL80,000 and fan belts - 80 pieces @ SLL20,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 283,600. 

In the future, Daniel plans to educate his children, build a shop, and construct another house. He feels happy about taking this loan and it will help to generate more income. He serves 20 customers each day. His business is popular because he sells spare parts and also fixes the vehicles up for his customers. He is assisted by his family members. His suppliers are located in Freetown. He travels to get his goods by public transport. He buys his goods at least twice per month. Some of the profits are being ploughed back into the business and some to solve domestic problems. He has the plans to expand and this can be achieved by continuously accessing loans from ARD. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clutches - 30 sets @ SLL80,000 and fan belts - 80 pieces @ SLL20,000.

loans.name: Mohamed Unisa

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has one child who is 6 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is in school. 

In 2006, Mohamed established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began this business because he wanted to provide his basic needs after leaving school and it is his only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 950,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy Nokia phones, Nokia batteries, memory cards, and Motorola chargers for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to establish a large mobile shop, to own a house, and to educate his child.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 25 year-old Ibrahim. He is married to a business woman and has 1 child, aged 4 years, who is going to school. In 2005, Ibrahim established his business selling mobile phones, phone batteries, top-up cards, ear phones, phone chargers, memory cards, MPs and drinks. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,954,500 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to purchase the following items: mobile phones - 16 pieces @ SLL 250,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 295,450. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a house, provide a quality education for his child and to have a shop. He feels happy about taking this loan as it will help him to increase his income. His major problem is with the phone batteries because customers will buy them and sometimes returns them for being damaged. He serves over 100 customers each day. His business is popular. He is assisted by his spouse. His suppliers are located in Freetown. He transports his goods by public vehicle and he makes purchases twice in a month. He ploughs some of his profit into the business and uses the balance to buy building materials. He is planning to expand and this can be accomplished by managing the business well. Ibrahim is trust worthy and hardworking.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones - 16 pieces @ SLL 250,000.

loans.name: Isatu B.

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Isatu B. She is married to a contractor and has 4 children, aged 15, 13, 11 and 8 years. All are school going children. In 1996, Isatu B established her baby clothing and utensils business. She began her business because she came from a poor background; she had to do petty trading after school hours to pay her school fees. Things got harder for her because she had to drop out of school. She was peddling everyday to help her parents and younger ones. She then got married and her husband helped her with a small amount of funds for the business. Since then, she has developed gradually. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 5,481,000 every month from this business. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Isatu B has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase baby wrappers - 4 dozen @ SLL 216,000, baby powder - 10 dozen @ SLL 80,000, baby walkers - 4 dozen @ SLL 180,000 and flasks - 2 dozen @ SLL 720,000, the balance of SLL 176,000 is to be used for transportation costs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 822,000. 

In the future, Isatu B plans to build a house. The loan is another source of generating income, so it is good. She is nervous because she has worked very hard to be where she is now, and she wants her business to grow bigger. She hopes her children will be better people in society. She wants them to achieve what she has not been as fortunate to get. Her only challenge is the fluctuation in transportation costs. Her competitors are few, besides she has more items than they do and of better quality.   

Isatu serves about 30 customers per day, women and petty traders around town and villages. Her business is popular because she always has good customer care and good quality goods at affordable prices. She usually travels by vehicle three times in the month. and to Conakry once every two months to purchase her goods. She saves some of her profit and uses some as an additional capital for the business.  

She has enough savings now that she has acquired a piece of land which she is looking forward to develop. She is also planning to expand her business by acquiring more loans and saving enough of her profit. She is hard working and competitive. Isatu B wants to achieve her dreams by educating her children through acquiring subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase baby wrappers - 4 dozen @ SLL 216,000, baby powder - 10 dozen @ SLL 80,000, baby walkers - 4 dozen @ SLL180,000 and flasks - 2 dozen @ SLL720,000, the balance of SLL 176,000 is to be used for transportation costs.

loans.name: Kaliman

texts.ru: Калиман 60 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Калиман 35 лет проработала продавцом в магазине, сейчас на пенсии. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Калиман занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 2002 году с покупки двух бычков на сумму 25,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Калиман, ее поголовье насчитывает 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 4 бычка и 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калиман обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Калиман планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья.
texts.en: Kaliman is 60 years old and married. She has brought up four children. For 35 years Kaliman used to work as a store salesperson. Now she is retired. In order to provide income for her family, Kaliman raises livestock. Having started in 2002 by purchasing two bulls costing 25,000 KGS, she now has a farm brining in about 15,000 KGS monthly from sales of dairy and milk product. Thanks to Kaliman’s hard work, her livestock now includes two cows, one horse, four bulls and five sheep. In order to develop her business further, Kaliman turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS intended for purchasing livestock. Kaliman plans to invest her revenues into increasing her livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Hamza. He is married and has three children ages 12, 9, and 6 years.

In 2006, Hamza established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began this business just for self empowerment and it provides a solution to his problems. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 950,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Hazma would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy mobile phones and accessories. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Hamza plans to complete the construction of his house, to rent a house, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef, from Gaza, works as a carpenter in his own business. He is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children. On the 1st of January 2011, Yousef started his project. He hopes to get this loan in order to buy a saw, which will increase production capacity, leading to increased profit and income.

loans.use: to buy a saw.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a 60-year-old married mother of seven children, lives in Masindi Uganda where she has been involved in farming since she was 20. While price fluctuations and seasonal weather hinder her business, her dream is to build a permanent house and buy a motorcycle. Mary intends to use this loan to pay workers who are clearing land for maize growing.

loans.use: to pay workers who are clearing land for maize growing.

loans.name: Martha Del Rosario

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 57 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ganados su historia empezó cuando realizaba y venta de cerdos y la Sr. Martha aprendió de él y comenzó también en este comercio, su trabajo lo hace sola todas las tardes, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 5 hijos, su sueño más importante es desea acondicionar las chancherías para tener mejor producción y salud para seguir adelante. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ganado y asi comprar cerdos.
texts.en:
Martha is a 57-year-old woman who has many aspirations for the next years, including to prosper in selling livestock. Her story began with Martha raising and selling pigs, as she learned about it, and beginning to enter the trade. She works alone every afternoon, without difficulties. 

Martha isn't married and has 5 children. Her most important dream is her desire to improve her pigpens so she can increase production and animal health and forge ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to assist in livestock sales and, also, to buy more pigs.

loans.use: To improve her pigpens and to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Développement Plus Group

texts.en:
Henri is a leader of the Community Bank named “Développement Plus,” which consists of 12 members. These members are jointly united for receiving loans from Kiva and HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.

Henri has been a micro entrepreneur since 2000. He sells vehicle spare parts in the southwestern part of Kinshasa. He joined one Hope’s groups in 2010. Seven loans received from Hope have strengthened his business. He is planning with the next loan to increase his inventory by adding some vehicle spares pieces to resell at profit. Currently, Henri’s business makes about $200 of profit per month.

Henri is ambitious and dreams someday to open a spare parts shop. Henri is 46 years old, married, and the father of five children. Their ages vary between 2 and 18 years. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some vehicle spares parts for reselling at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia lives in Masindi-Uganda where she has the responsibility of taking care of her three children. Scovia started a salon three years ago, and while facing the challenges posed by price fluctuations, inflation and transportation costs, she is now requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for sale and use in her salon.

She desires to educate her children, buy a car, diversify her business and hire employees to help expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale and use in her salon.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 29 and charged with the responsibility for taking care of his four children and wife. He used to work as a civil servant, but with two million UGX that he saved from his monthly salary, he opened a bar and phone accessories shop in Masindi, Uganda.

Jonathan is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM in order to buy tents, chairs and tables to rent to customers. He wants to educate his children, build a permanent house and through his business earn twenty million UGX in working capital by 2014.

loans.use: to buy tents, chairs and tables to rent to customers.

loans.name: Hilton

texts.en:
Hilton, 39, is married with four children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been doing well despite the challenges presented by unpredictable seasonal weather and price fluctuations.

Hilton intends to use a 1,600,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to prepare his fields ahead of the planting season. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to prepare his fields ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo como docente peron la socia ya no trabaja como profesora ,ahora la socia se esta dedicando al negocio de venta y elaboracion de manualidades,ella hace trabajos en pintura,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las manualidades.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales como hilos,pinturas y maderas.

Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member previously worked as a teacher, but she doesn´t teach anymore. Now she is working in the handicraft making and selling business; she does craftwork with paint. The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Through this little business, she keeps her children going. The member’s dream is to have premises where she can sell her handicrafts. She is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as thread, paint and wood. 
Juana is grateful for the opportunity given here and, likewise, she promises to carry out the payment according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread, paint and wood.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 37, is married with four children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He runs a grocery shop that has enabled him to support his family. Price fluctuations and inflation, customers who do not pay on time and thieves affect his business.

Richard wants a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy sugar, salt and rice to sell from his shop. His dream is to educate his children, buy a motorcycle and diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice to sell from his shop.

loans.name: Maraman

texts.en:
Maraman is a 38-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Maraman is a women stylist; she is well-known in her area and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase equipment needed to improve her home salon.

Maraman is looking to open a beauty salon so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed to improve her salon.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric, 32, is married and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows tea, a common source of income in this region. He inherited the fields upon which he grew up and now grows tea. Droughts that cause his tea crops to dry up are his challenge.

Eric is asking for a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy manure and pesticides for his tea plantation. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his two children.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is married and owns a transport business. The motorcycle transport is a major business opportunity in the region due to the lack of good road networks in most areas. He purchased the motorcycle with his savings.

Salim is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to repair the motorcycle and also to help him start another business. He looks forward to owning a three-wheeler vehicle in the near future or to purchase a taxi or van for transport.

The challenges facing Salim’s current business are the seasonal business climate and the overall inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle transport and also to start another transport business

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo, age 52, owns a motorcycle spare parts shop in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He accumulated his start-up capital from selling produce. 

He would like to obtain a loan in order to buy motorcycle spare parts to offer for resale. 

Leo dreams of providing for the education of his eight children and expanding his business into new markets

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to offer for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 40, owns and operates a retail shop. He began as a farmer, and he is still engaged in farming to supplement his retail shop business.

John hopes to obtain a loan to buy sugar and sodas to offer for sale in his shop. 

His dream is to provide for his children's education and to grow his shop to wholesale status.

loans.use: to buy sugar and sodas to offer for sale in his shop

loans.name: Ever Jose
